column4: well my routers & firewalls could just as well use 80's h/w but the 90's stuff is more reliable & actually available - then again, I have come to the conclusion of using OpenBSD for firewalling - just because it needs practically no management beyond annual (or biannual) upgrade
nothing like a 286...aaahhh how the memories come back
well I'm not sure what happened to my 386sx16 w/ 16 megs of ram (full upgrades, about half of the motherboard surface covered w/ ram)
the keyboard it came with (Cherry) is still in use
